story:
Covid-19 Pandemic

First, I hope that you are all well during these trying times, and thank you for taking the time to review our project.

Now, more than ever, we have an urgency to make this succeed.  Both my wife and I are self-employed and our businesses have been hurt.  We also have to provide for my Mom, who's in a memory care facility in the late stages of dementia.  Everyday bills and obligations are something we all need to deal with and we understand.  We are committed to utilizing any funding we receive to complete this project as the rewards will be great.  You can be confident that we will be applying all funding to this project. 

This is a means to an end.

 

The Bravo Project

Patented Gear Components For Performance Powerboats

 

Overview

  1. We've created a Patented solution to a problem that has been apparent for 12+ years. 

  2. This is for gears in a boat stern drive, like a transmission.

  3. The gears break often.

  4. This costs boat owners time off the water and money.

  5. Application is for fresh water and off-shore powerboats like Cigarette, Fountain, Baja.

  6. There are thousands of the Bravo XR stern drives in use.

  7. Mercury Marine continues to produce the Bravo XR drives.

  8. The market potential is estimated at 1,000 gear sets per year in the U.S. alone.

This is a $3.5MM annual market potential minimum! 

Stages Of Funding And Production

First Stage

  • Finish Prototypes For Testing including:

    • 3D laser scan existing prototype gears' tooth profile

    • Generate 3D CAD drawings from laser scan

    • 3D print revised support rings and test fitment

    • 5-Axis CNC machine revised support rings

    • Deliver finished prototypes to drive builders to test

 

Second Stage

  • Secure orders 

  • Produce and deliver final product

 

Third Stage

  • Produce prototypes of patented one-piece version

  • Deliver prototypes for assembly and testing

 

Fourth Stage

  • Secure orders for one-piece version

  • 5-axis CNC machine final product and deliver

 

What We Need

Stage One

  • $20,000 for 3D scanning, CAD drawings and 5-axis CNC machining of new rings

Stage Two

  • $40,000 for the first 20 sets of production gears

Stage Three

  • $60,000 for 5-axis CNC machining of one-piece design and testing

Stage Four

  • Final Costing to be determined

 

We are in need of funding to create a small quantity of revised support rings and then assemble the parts into functioning prototypes.  We will then present to industry leaders for testing and potential orders. In addition, we will be allocating funds to marketing, which is mainly comprised of time and travel.  A small portion will go towards packaging, but being this is an industrial product, there are no special needs like colored boxes or point of purchase displays.

All Aspects of the Project Are

What You Get

We are offering Unsalted No Sharks gear

Get it?

My dear friend from High School, Linda Weber, has an awesome line of casual gear focused on fresh water lakes in the United States.   

  • For those that have a need for these particular gear sets, we are offering a huge discount and will ship them as soon as possible.

 

  • ​Not many folks will be able to use our product so we had to come up with something boat/water related to keep with our niche. ​

​

  • ​EVERY person that helps us with a funding contribution will receive a collection of her gear based upon the amount of funding as a thank you!

 

  • If you are not able to help, thank you for your consideration!  And please see Linda Weber if you like her products at http://nosharksgear.com​

​

  • Whatever level of funding you help us achieve will be utilized to produce the CNC support rings for testing.  Where there is a will there is a way!  

 

 

Why Am I Doing This?

  • My Mom

    • Mom has led a remarkable life as a concert pianist, Mother and MBA graduate.  She is now in the late stages of dementia requiring dedicated care. After exhausting her resources it's now upon my family to provide the safety, security and care that she deserves.  I would not be here without my parents support.

  • Fulfillment of a Lifelong Dream

    • I've always believed that I had the ability to create something new.  My Grandfather, Mom's father, was an engineer with Western Electric and had a dozen plus patents in his lifetime.  And after seeing two of my ideas on store shelves before I could even begin the process gave me the confidence to keep trying.
    • With the potential success of this project it will allow me to pursue several additional patentable projects in fields that will impact the environment and create opportunities for the underserved folks in our world.
    • Pay It Forward

 

The Bravo Project

This campaign is the culmination of the years of experience I've gained in design and manufacturing.  I had no idea how complicated gear design is and to this day still say it's rocket science!  

The Bravo Project is an improvement on an existing Original Equipment Manufacturer's gear design through advanced analysis, design and manufacturing. 

Copyright owned by Mercury Marine.

This Is What The Bravo XR Drives Look Like On A Boat

 

Here's The Problem

Many recreational and marine work force boats utilize stern drive propulsion systems such as the Bravo XR manufactured by Mercury Marine (Brunswick Corporation).  The Bravo XR stern drive transmission specifically utilizes a cone clutch method to allow the engine torque to be transmitted to the propeller in either the forward or reverse direction, eliminating the need for a dedicated transmission.


The above described stern drive units provided by Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) have been designed for use within certain horsepower and torque specifications including maximum recommendations.  Boat operation and/or engine modifications can cause stresses to the stern drive unit components which may cause them to prematurely fail, specifically the bevel gears of the cone clutch, due to fatigue or yield stresses, causing more frequent and costly repairs.


Boat operation necessitates the modulation of the throttle in different surface conditions as the water produces resistance to the drive system through the propeller/s.   Calm surface conditions create somewhat stable resistance forces.  Chop or larger wave conditions create intermittent resistance forces as boat speed increases.  Proper operation of a boat is to utilize the throttle to increase power and speed while the drive is submerged, and reduce the throttle input if/when the drive is out of the water.  As the boat’s speed increases and achieves plane, the drives can leave the water which significantly reduces the resistance to the propeller, creating an over-rev situation.  The operator must then reduce throttle input and engine/propeller rpm to more closely match the boat speed at the point the drive and propeller returns and reengages with the water surface to avoid a thrust shock to the equipment. Failure and the resulting damage of the stern drives and their components occur when the boat and drive reconnect with the water and the resistance, or load, is transmitted to the drive in the form of a shock.  This is a regular occurrence and the modulation technique is required regardless of engine horsepower, torque or drive specification limits.

This is a perfect example of tooth shear at the root.  This also shows the toe (or top) of the tooth completely unconnected as designed from the factory.


As boat owners increase the horsepower and torque of their engines, while still utilizing the OEM stern drives, they increase the likelihood of failure of the stern drives as the input exceeds the design limits.   The results are more frequent and costly repairs as well as reduced time and enjoyment on the water. Failures occur throughout the drive components and will typically cascade and compound.  Several methods and improvements to shafts, case housings and other related components have been developed and are available as retrofits.  These improvements tend to solve specific component durability issues yet pass on the potential failure to the components not improved.   The cone clutch gear set, its design and method of manufacture have not been addressed.


As a result, the OEM bevel gears suffer from a lack of proper structural support of the gear teeth, non-optimal tooth profile and failure of the friction weld.

Our design improvements focus on the three points of failure.

  1. Unsupported toe of the bevel gear teeth.  
  2. Overall non-optimized tooth design including tooth, root and contact profiles.  
  3. Failure of the friction weld that joins the two component parts. 

 

What We Have Done

I've already funded this Bravo Project personally to get it to initial prototype phase. 

  1. Metalurgical analysis of the OEM gears including composition, chemistry and hardness.
  2. Laser scanning of the OEM gears.
  3. Finite Element Analysis (FEA) of the stresses experienced by the OEM gears under load.
  4. Von Mises Simulations of stresses under a 1,000 HP/TQ load level.
  5. Engineering design of new gear configurations.
  6. Prototype manufacture.
  7. Utility Patent application and grant, including all patent attorney fees and filing fees.
  8. Patent # 10,577,069 B1

First 3D Print Of Ring Gear In Progress

 

Completed 3D Print Of Ring Gear

 

 

The Analysis and Results

 

Finite Element Analysis of OEM gear pinpoints stress point where failures typically occur. 

 

Finite Element Analysis of Bravo Project design showing reduction of stress.

The improvement over the stock OEM gear is 2.5 times reduced stress!

 

Benefits

The two greatest benefits are:

  1. Creating a value proposition for clients that saves them money.
  2. Increasing their time on the water.

By supporting us, you will be:

  1. Keeping thousands of boat owners on the water longer before repairs are needed.
  2. Reducing the frequency of stern drive repairs saving boaters millions of dollars.
  3. Increasing the revenue of boating venues, lakes and the like by millions of dollars.
  4. Compensating stern drive repair facilities with higher profit margins to offset the reduced incidences of stern drive repairs.

What is more important to a boat owner than maximizing the time on the water?

How can you put a dollar amount on that precious time?

 

What Happened

We went to a gear manufacturer and had them create 20 sets of the 2 parts of the 3-piece design and the pinion gear, which are made on conventional Gleason gear cutting machines.  I was there when they were cutting them and it went just fine.  We had the Ring made by another machine shop utilizing a 5-axis machine.  

When it was time to put the 3-piece design together, the Support Ring was not snug as per the design.  We have determined that we need to produce another set of the support ring to more accurately fit the Gleason cut gear tooth profile.

This is the Support Ring in it's fixture after 5-axis machining.

This is the Support Ring being measured by precision CMM.

Computer Analysis of Support Ring​

​​

The Impact

  • This is a unique solution, as we found in our patent search, application and granting.  We've come up with a novel and one-off design to support this style of gear, and while this is a marine application, there are potentially other uses.

 

  • This gear set continues to be produced for new Mercury Bravo XR drives as well as replacements for worn or broken gears.  The market will continue into the future for many years to come.

 

  • The performance boating world has been clamoring for a solution since the inception of the drive in the early 2000's.  There are currently many aftermarket parts offerings available to prolong the life of the drives including upgraded shafts and housings.

 

  • The design of the gears themselves, in that they have a receptacle for the cone clutch, inhibits an easy solution to upgrading the gears through conventional means.  That's why this solution is so unique. 

People have been stumped but not us!

 

  • The most significant values of this new product are:
    • ​The amount of time a boat owner will be able to spend enjoying their passion.
      • ​There is predominantly a limited time to comfortably boat in the U.S., ranging from 3-5 months. If our product could extend that boating season how much would that be worth to someone? 
    • ​Dollars, plain and simple.
      • ​We will be asking for a premium over the existing OEM gear offering but predict that our gears will extend the life of the drive, given proper operation and maintenance, by 2 to 4 times.  
      • The Return On Investment would be extremely fast.

​

Risks & Challenges

  • Now that we have been through a prototype build, we've learned valuable lessons in purchase order contract development.  We will be requiring CMM or laser measurement testing of ALL parts that come off the line in the future, not just random sampling to avoid any quality and dimensional deviations.
  • We have excellent engineers that will be guiding us through this next phase.
  • We have spoken with several stern drive experts and have been assured that the need and demand is there to support this effort.

About Us

Hi, I'm John Allert.  I've worn a lot of hats in my working years, primarily as a sales consultant in the computer and telecom industries.  Got laid off in the telecom bust in 2003 and couldn't even get an interview.  So, I had to figure it out on my own by developing some new products and learning new skills like CAD, metal fabrication, laser programming, forming and welding.  In addition to the images below, you can visit my website to view what I am currently producing at: http://redalertracegear.com 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please support your organization of choice regarding Dementia and Alzheimer's diseases.  http://alz.org 
  • If you would be so kind, please share this with your friends, family or colleagues that might have an interest.
  • And don't forget to use the Indiegogo Share Tools!

Thank you so much for your time.
story_txt:
Covid-19 Pandemic
First, I hope that you are all well during these trying times, and thank you for taking the time to review our project.
Now, more than ever, we have an urgency to make this succeed.  Both my wife and I are self-employed and our businesses have been hurt.  We also have to provide for my Mom, who's in a memory care facility in the late stages of dementia.  Everyday bills and obligations are something we all need to deal with and we understand.  We are committed to utilizing any funding we receive to complete this project as the rewards will be great.  You can be confident that we will be applying all funding to this project.  
This is a means to an end.
 
The Bravo Project
Patented Gear Components For Performance Powerboats
 
Overview

We've created a Patented solution to a problem that has been apparent for 12+ years. 
This is for gears in a boat stern drive, like a transmission.
The gears break often.
This costs boat owners time off the water and money.
Application is for fresh water and off-shore powerboats like Cigarette, Fountain, Baja.
There are thousands of the Bravo XR stern drives in use.
Mercury Marine continues to produce the Bravo XR drives.
The market potential is estimated at 1,000 gear sets per year in the U.S. alone.

This is a $3.5MM annual market potential minimum! 

Stages Of Funding And Production
First Stage

Finish Prototypes For Testing including:

3D laser scan existing prototype gears' tooth profile
Generate 3D CAD drawings from laser scan
3D print revised support rings and test fitment
5-Axis CNC machine revised support rings
Deliver finished prototypes to drive builders to test


 
Second Stage

Secure orders 
Produce and deliver final product

 
Third Stage

Produce prototypes of patented one-piece version
Deliver prototypes for assembly and testing

 
Fourth Stage

Secure orders for one-piece version
5-axis CNC machine final product and deliver

 
What We Need
Stage One
$20,000 for 3D scanning, CAD drawings and 5-axis CNC machining of new rings
Stage Two
$40,000 for the first 20 sets of production gears
Stage Three
$60,000 for 5-axis CNC machining of one-piece design and testing
Stage Four
Final Costing to be determined
 
We are in need of funding to create a small quantity of revised support rings and then assemble the parts into functioning prototypes.  We will then present to industry leaders for testing and potential orders. In addition, we will be allocating funds to marketing, which is mainly comprised of time and travel.  A small portion will go towards packaging, but being this is an industrial product, there are no special needs like colored boxes or point of purchase displays.
All Aspects of the Project Are


What You Get



We are offering Unsalted No Sharks gear
Get it?
My dear friend from High School, Linda Weber, has an awesome line of casual gear focused on fresh water lakes in the United States.   
For those that have a need for these particular gear sets, we are offering a huge discount and will ship them as soon as possible.
 

​Not many folks will be able to use our product so we had to come up with something boat/water related to keep with our niche. ​

​
​EVERY person that helps us with a funding contribution will receive a collection of her gear based upon the amount of funding as a thank you!
 

If you are not able to help, thank you for your consideration!  And please see Linda Weber if you like her products at http://nosharksgear.com​

​
Whatever level of funding you help us achieve will be utilized to produce the CNC support rings for testing.  Where there is a will there is a way!  
 
 

Why Am I Doing This?


My Mom
Mom has led a remarkable life as a concert pianist, Mother and MBA graduate.  She is now in the late stages of dementia requiring dedicated care. After exhausting her resources it's now upon my family to provide the safety, security and care that she deserves.  I would not be here without my parents support.


Fulfillment of a Lifelong Dream

I've always believed that I had the ability to create something new.  My Grandfather, Mom's father, was an engineer with Western Electric and had a dozen plus patents in his lifetime.  And after seeing two of my ideas on store shelves before I could even begin the process gave me the confidence to keep trying.

With the potential success of this project it will allow me to pursue several additional patentable projects in fields that will impact the environment and create opportunities for the underserved folks in our world.
Pay It Forward



 
The Bravo Project
This campaign is the culmination of the years of experience I've gained in design and manufacturing.  I had no idea how complicated gear design is and to this day still say it's rocket science!  
The Bravo Project is an improvement on an existing Original Equipment Manufacturer's gear design through advanced analysis, design and manufacturing. 

Copyright owned by Mercury Marine.

This Is What The Bravo XR Drives Look Like On A Boat
 
Here's The Problem
Many recreational and marine work force boats utilize stern drive propulsion systems such as the Bravo XR manufactured by Mercury Marine (Brunswick Corporation).  The Bravo XR stern drive transmission specifically utilizes a cone clutch method to allow the engine torque to be transmitted to the propeller in either the forward or reverse direction, eliminating the need for a dedicated transmission.
The above described stern drive units provided by Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) have been designed for use within certain horsepower and torque specifications including maximum recommendations.  Boat operation and/or engine modifications can cause stresses to the stern drive unit components which may cause them to prematurely fail, specifically the bevel gears of the cone clutch, due to fatigue or yield stresses, causing more frequent and costly repairs.
Boat operation necessitates the modulation of the throttle in different surface conditions as the water produces resistance to the drive system through the propeller/s.   Calm surface conditions create somewhat stable resistance forces.  Chop or larger wave conditions create intermittent resistance forces as boat speed increases.  Proper operation of a boat is to utilize the throttle to increase power and speed while the drive is submerged, and reduce the throttle input if/when the drive is out of the water.  As the boat’s speed increases and achieves plane, the drives can leave the water which significantly reduces the resistance to the propeller, creating an over-rev situation.  The operator must then reduce throttle input and engine/propeller rpm to more closely match the boat speed at the point the drive and propeller returns and reengages with the water surface to avoid a thrust shock to the equipment. Failure and the resulting damage of the stern drives and their components occur when the boat and drive reconnect with the water and the resistance, or load, is transmitted to the drive in the form of a shock.  This is a regular occurrence and the modulation technique is required regardless of engine horsepower, torque or drive specification limits.

This is a perfect example of tooth shear at the root.  This also shows the toe (or top) of the tooth completely unconnected as designed from the factory.
As boat owners increase the horsepower and torque of their engines, while still utilizing the OEM stern drives, they increase the likelihood of failure of the stern drives as the input exceeds the design limits.   The results are more frequent and costly repairs as well as reduced time and enjoyment on the water. Failures occur throughout the drive components and will typically cascade and compound.  Several methods and improvements to shafts, case housings and other related components have been developed and are available as retrofits.  These improvements tend to solve specific component durability issues yet pass on the potential failure to the components not improved.   The cone clutch gear set, its design and method of manufacture have not been addressed.
As a result, the OEM bevel gears suffer from a lack of proper structural support of the gear teeth, non-optimal tooth profile and failure of the friction weld.
Our design improvements focus on the three points of failure. 

Unsupported toe of the bevel gear teeth.  
Overall non-optimized tooth design including tooth, root and contact profiles.  
Failure of the friction weld that joins the two component parts. 

 
What We Have Done
I've already funded this Bravo Project personally to get it to initial prototype phase. 

Metalurgical analysis of the OEM gears including composition, chemistry and hardness.
Laser scanning of the OEM gears.
Finite Element Analysis (FEA) of the stresses experienced by the OEM gears under load.
Von Mises Simulations of stresses under a 1,000 HP/TQ load level.
Engineering design of new gear configurations.
Prototype manufacture.
Utility Patent application and grant, including all patent attorney fees and filing fees.
Patent # 10,577,069 B1


First 3D Print Of Ring Gear In Progress
 

Completed 3D Print Of Ring Gear
 
 
The Analysis and Results
 
Finite Element Analysis of OEM gear pinpoints stress point where failures typically occur. 

 
Finite Element Analysis of Bravo Project design showing reduction of stress.

The improvement over the stock OEM gear is 2.5 times reduced stress!
 
Benefits
The two greatest benefits are:

Creating a value proposition for clients that saves them money.
Increasing their time on the water.

By supporting us, you will be:

Keeping thousands of boat owners on the water longer before repairs are needed.
Reducing the frequency of stern drive repairs saving boaters millions of dollars.
Increasing the revenue of boating venues, lakes and the like by millions of dollars.
Compensating stern drive repair facilities with higher profit margins to offset the reduced incidences of stern drive repairs.

What is more important to a boat owner than maximizing the time on the water?
How can you put a dollar amount on that precious time?
 
What Happened
We went to a gear manufacturer and had them create 20 sets of the 2 parts of the 3-piece design and the pinion gear, which are made on conventional Gleason gear cutting machines.  I was there when they were cutting them and it went just fine.  We had the Ring made by another machine shop utilizing a 5-axis machine.  
When it was time to put the 3-piece design together, the Support Ring was not snug as per the design.  We have determined that we need to produce another set of the support ring to more accurately fit the Gleason cut gear tooth profile.

This is the Support Ring in it's fixture after 5-axis machining.

This is the Support Ring being measured by precision CMM.

Computer Analysis of Support Ring​
​​

The Impact
This is a unique solution, as we found in our patent search, application and granting.  We've come up with a novel and one-off design to support this style of gear, and while this is a marine application, there are potentially other uses.
 
This gear set continues to be produced for new Mercury Bravo XR drives as well as replacements for worn or broken gears.  The market will continue into the future for many years to come.
 
The performance boating world has been clamoring for a solution since the inception of the drive in the early 2000's.  There are currently many aftermarket parts offerings available to prolong the life of the drives including upgraded shafts and housings.
 
The design of the gears themselves, in that they have a receptacle for the cone clutch, inhibits an easy solution to upgrading the gears through conventional means.  That's why this solution is so unique.  
People have been stumped but not us!
 

The most significant values of this new product are:

​The amount of time a boat owner will be able to spend enjoying their passion.​There is predominantly a limited time to comfortably boat in the U.S., ranging from 3-5 months. If our product could extend that boating season how much would that be worth to someone? 


​Dollars, plain and simple.
​We will be asking for a premium over the existing OEM gear offering but predict that our gears will extend the life of the drive, given proper operation and maintenance, by 2 to 4 times.  
The Return On Investment would be extremely fast.




​

Risks & Challenges

Now that we have been through a prototype build, we've learned valuable lessons in purchase order contract development.  We will be requiring CMM or laser measurement testing of ALL parts that come off the line in the future, not just random sampling to avoid any quality and dimensional deviations.
We have excellent engineers that will be guiding us through this next phase.
We have spoken with several stern drive experts and have been assured that the need and demand is there to support this effort.


About Us

Hi, I'm John Allert.  I've worn a lot of hats in my working years, primarily as a sales consultant in the computer and telecom industries.  Got laid off in the telecom bust in 2003 and couldn't even get an interview.  So, I had to figure it out on my own by developing some new products and learning new skills like CAD, metal fabrication, laser programming, forming and welding.  In addition to the images below, you can visit my website to view what I am currently producing at: http://redalertracegear.com 
 
Other Ways You Can Help

Please support your organization of choice regarding Dementia and Alzheimer's diseases.  http://alz.org 
If you would be so kind, please share this with your friends, family or colleagues that might have an interest.
And don't forget to use the Indiegogo Share Tools!

Thank you so much for your time.

story:
How do I install ZHOR?

ZHOR can be installed by anyone, you have to choose where to place it, drill a hole for all the cables plus four fixing points, connect all cables according to the supplied instructions and secure the console to your car’s dashboard. This is not complicated but if you prefer, you can go to your usual garage and ask someone to do it.

How can I connect audio to my car’s stereo?

ZHOR can stream audio to your car by Bluetooth. If your car’s stereo does not have this function, you can simply connect the audio cable to the AUX line in.

Where can I place the rear-parking camera?

You should choose a place in your car’s rear, near the license plate. Then you drill a hole with the supplied equipment and install the cable from the camera to ZHOR.

How to calibrate the guidelines in the rear-parking camera?

Since all cars are different, you must calibrate the guidelines to meet your cars specifications (size and height are an important factor). A simple process in the setup menu can achieve this.

What is this OBD2 connector?

This connector is used to send data from your car’s onboard computer to ZHOR. This way ZHOR knows how much fuel you are spending, how much do you still have and other important information.

Can ZHOR send data to my car’s computer?

No. This OBD2 connection is only for retrieving data to ZHOR, it cannot send data to your car’s computer(s).

Does the mirror function work on iOS?

At this moment we cannot guarantee that the mirror function will work since specifications of future iOS can make this function inoperative. On our prototype we were able to see the iOS device screen, but not interact with it.

Is there a jog shuttle to connect to ZHOR?

At the moment we have not developed a jog shuttle (remote control) for ZHOR. It is however in our future plans to build one.

story:
Say Hello to PED

the bicycle pedals of tomorrow!

 

Lack of visibility on the road is one of the main causes of accidents with other vehicles, especially during evening time and when turning. PED stands as a solution to this problem, entering the market as the first pedal with integrated turn signals. 

 

 

PED aims to promote the use of the bicycle in the city, allowing cyclists to increase their visibility and to feel safer on the road. PED won the international startup EUROBIKE competition. Now, we want to make our product available to everyone!

 

 

The Impact of a revolutionary pedal!

SPEAROAD has developed PED, the first smart bike pedals with turn signals.

 

 

PED comes with a remote controller to be positioned on the handlebar of the bicycle. Simply act on it to light up the pedals and to show your position on the road. By using the two buttons on the remote controller, you can independently activate each pedal pointing your intention to turn.

 

 

Lights on the pedal provide 360 degrees visibility: all vehicles around will be able to see you and to understand where you are going! 

 

Features:

Remote controlled

Position light and turn direction light

360° Visibility

USB charging

About 6 days of Autonomy (normal use)

Grip surface

Water-resistant

Standard axle thread 9/16'' (as for the majority of bicycles)

A special wrench to mount the pedals against thefts

Exclusive product (patented by SPEAROAD)

 

 

Who we are

 

PED originates from the collaboration between the startup SPEAROAD and the historic company F.lli Schiano. SPEAROAD is a startup founded by four young engineers who love bicycles and look forward to improving cyclist safety on the road. F.lli Schiano is an Italian manufacturer of bicycles for sport and leisure activities for adults and children. Founded in 1923, the company is passionate about cycling and it manufactures several models of bicycles, from the child ones to the vintage ones.

 

 

Other ways you can help

 

Any pledge amount brings us one step closer to our goal. Help us to turn the PED idea into a real product by contributing and sustaining the project, and by helping us to spread the word by sharing our story!

With PED we've combined the pleasure of cycling with a new technology to improve your safety on the road. If you believe in our project, help us to sustain it and join our community!

Follow us on our social media to stay tuned:

INSTAGRAM - SPEAROAD - INSTAGRAM - F.lli Schiano

FACEBOOK - SPEAROAD   - FACEBOOK - F.lli Schiano

story:
No more obstacle with the all-terrain wheel!

No one of your commutes is perfect, path, sidewalks, pothole

 

 

 

 

We think to all situations and put a handle to carry it when you can't ride!

 

 

 

The perfect electric vehicle.

Lightweight, practical, powerful. A real mean of transportation. Sneak up everywhere and quickly. Think about it, no need to wait in traffic jams, spend 15 minutes finding a parking space or a bike rack. Carry the SMOOF-1 everywhere with you. An active means of transportation, and with strong sensations.

Today there are many ways of moving electric. But how many are practical, reliable, and last in time?

We do not buy a car to make 500 km with it and leave it at the garage because of a breakdown. We have the same vision regarding our products.

And if you ever encounter a problem we provide you a real, quick and good after-sales service.

 

Our remote fit in any pocket!

 

 

 

 

Another one? NO!

The SMOOF-1 is not just an electric longboard, is YOUR electric longboard! Why?

We are working hard on an app where you will be able to change all the parameters, the max speed, the acceleration, the braking force, and your throttle curve.

It's your companion app, where you could be able to see our last-events, your data with your board and create an account for a quick and good after-sales service in case of a problem.

 

But the most important for us! Our shop is on this app to be more secure, quicker and closer to you. 

 

 

 

 

Why we need you?

 

We need you today to finish the industrialization of our project.

For this we only need to accomplish two more steps :

The industrialization of the board: We have to pay fees to pay the mold to press and assemble the ply of wood that will compose the board. This step is more expensive for us than other brands of electric longboard or classic longboards because we want to make high-quality boards, resistant, but also eco-designed and all in France to reduce the pollution due to transport.

This is our future board :

 

 

Industrialization of the case: We also have to make the mold that will be used to manufacture our case containing all the electronic components. This one will also be realized in France. 

And this is it :

 

 

 

 

What did you get?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What are the risks?

Let's talk about the risks for you first. The only thing today that you risk is to adore our project, to finance it, and that it does not reach our financing goal. In this case, you will simply be reimbursed in full without being able to change the way you move.

Like all other projects, we can not guarantee specific deadlines, and these can be changed during the campaign. We will do our best to keep them

 

 

 

We challenge you!

To add some extra fun to this campaign!

Because the SMOOF-1 industrialization is not our only dream and the SMOOF-1 is not our only idea too!

 

 

 

 

Our story

 

We are three young peoples aged 19 years old to 20. We are passionate about longboard, sliding sensations, and moving in general. We are concerned about the environment and wanted to create a means of ecological locomotion replacing our cars and other polluting gear. We are Allan, Mathis, and Vincent and we have created the SMOOF-1 to revolutionize your daily commute.

 

 

 

 

 

Where's your money going?

We will be totally transparent with you during this campaign and it starts now by explaining to you where your money will go.

 

 

 

 

Other ways you can help us

 

You can also help us by sharing this fundraising campaign, or by talking about SMOOF-E around you. For any other help, proposals or needs, feel free to contact us on our email address contact@smoof-e.com.

story:
After years of teasing, the Boston Dynamics killer robot is finally for sale.

Let's get one and turn it into the world's coolest robot Unicorn.

Why?

- we totally need it

- it's your opportunity to play with such a toy

- my daughter wants to ride it to school

- you want to get friend with those robots before they rise and exterminate us

 

Preorder your ride now!

Only a few people in the world will ever meet Boston Dynamics' robots in a peaceful way. You can be one of them.

This will be a very unique attraction.

Like a pony, but 1000% better. You can brush her, feed her and take her for a walk. She will enjoy following you.
If your toddler is crazy enough, why not ride her? (14kg max payload - at your own risks)

We will organize meetups in Paris, Lyon, Grenoble, London, Barcelone, Berlin, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Las Vegas (at CES2022) and other major cities. The robot can also be visited at our location (Chambery, France).

See our perks!

 

Help us make your dream come true!

 

(This is a fixed goal campaign. 100% risk free. You get a 100% refund if the campain is not successful)

story:
Please join our Indiegogo community and help save this automotive art design masterpiece from extinction.  You could own the next BOXX to be built and driven around town!  

DRIVEN.co has obtained the original very first Brubaker Box.  the same car that appeared on the cover of Car and Driver magazine in March of 1972, all the sales brochures, and several movies.  We tracked it down and found it dilapidated and left for dead in a Florida swamp.  We could restore the car like we often do, and see it go into a private collection but we think the BOXX is truly special.  It deserves better.  It should be driven and enjoyed by you, those interested in art design and automotive BOXX aficionados everywhere.  

If you are shy this may not be the car for you.  BOXX draws a crowd and attention everywhere it goes.  Some say that BOXX was the very first true modern mini-van, but  BOXX artistic design almost defies traditional descriptions.  Its quirky utilitarian design was innovative in its day, and has become iconic.  It still looks futuristic today.   

BOXX is a fiberglass body shell kit that fits on an unmodified Volkswagen Beetle chassis after the car's body is removed.  BOXX turns a funky little Volkswagen Bug into one of the coolest cars you could ever possibly drive on the street.  Want to be the center of conversation anywhere you go?...…..then this is your ticket!!

YOU and BOXX?

BOXX is an amazing piece of artistic design that you can use and share.

BOXX attracts attention like no other vehicle.  Put that together with your business or enjoy the roads and shows with something no one else has.

BOXX is built to your personal tastes, by you, or with your kids, or buddies.  Each unique BOXX displays your take on the classic design and your pride of ownership.

BOXX is rare and almost extinct.  Join the team to save BOXX.  Let's get them back on the road, be it electric, hydrogen, 4x4, autonomous driving, or?

That's the gist of BOXX.........intrigued ????

For us geeks, there is a TON of information, history, BOXX future plans to go electric, 4x4 & more.  Dig In !!!

BOXX is a stunning example of artistic product design......rolling art, if you will.   BOXX is a fiberglass automobile body, produced by DRIVEN.co.  BOXX is a tribute to the Brubaker Box & AutoMecca Roamer sports van of which there were roughly 28  produced in the early 1970's.  BOXX can be adapted to fit a wide variety of different power plants and chassis such as electric (EV), hydrogen, hybrid or off road 4X4.  

YES, there is financing!  We have arranged long term financing to fund your project.  With your good credit, you could own a BOXX kit for as little as $239 per month! 

The Brubaker Box started life in Southern California and had roots with the renowned Art Center College of Design. Curtis Brubaker's idea was to create a sporty, utilitarian, and safety minded production vehicle.  Designer Curtis Brubaker and his team of Harry Wykes and Todd Gerstenberger, brought the design to life as the Brubaker Box.  The Brubaker Box was released in 1972 to rave reviews and sent shockwaves throughout the automotive world.  Its artistic design was futuristic and unique back in the 70's and this still holds true today.  

Only 3 Brubaker Boxes were ever built.  The company had plans for Volkswagen to provide chassis and drivetrains but the deal fell apart.  Brubaker was forced to close shop after the car made the March 1972 cover of Car and Driver magazine (above), which is the image many people remember.

Mike Hansen, an initial investor in the Brubaker Box, formed AutoMecca to continue to build additional cars. These second generation models were renamed the Roamer Sports Van.   AutoMecca built just 25 more cars before they too ceased production.  

AutoMecca even built and raced an off road racer named the "Baja Box" which competed in the Mickey Thompson Off Road Series race at Riverside, CA.  Mike Jr. was at the wheel and Dad riding shotgun.  Mike Jr. told us that because the driver seating position was so far back in the car, the Box was very safe.  That turned out to be a very good thing because one second after this photo was taken, the "Baja Box" crash landed on its nose and its racing days were over.

Sooooo........why now?   Interest in the BOXX design has only increased through the years.  With retro styling being so popular and world wide resurgence of interest in component cars, the timing is right.  BOXX has the ability to easily adapt to other modes of alternate power sources such as electric or hydrogen, or for simplicity, keep it original, utilizing plentiful and inexpensive VW Beetle components.  Many of the beetle's parts readily transfer over to applications on BOXX.  

With so few original examples of the Brubaker Box, high enthusiast demand and their skyrocketing value, BOXX fiberglass bodies make sense.  They allow this tour de force of rolling art, to once again be seen on public streets, to be shared with fellow enthusiasts.  Only 19 examples are known to still exist. so unfortunately most originals sit hidden in garages or languish in collections out of public view.  Since most enthusiasts have never actually seen one in person, BOXX has become almost a mythical item.........a unicorn of iconic artistic design.  

Many people's first exposure to the Brubaker Box was through movies and TV.  The 1976 television show "ARK II" featured a modified Brubaker Box they named "ROAMER" for the series. The Roamer likely became the most famous Box, where it appeared to be driven by children and even a chimpanzee.  A Brubaker Box was also featured in the movie "Grid Runners".

But perhaps  the most memorable appearance for the Brubaker Box was being featured in the classic movie Soylent Green, a 1973 Sci-Fi thriller set in, interestingly, the year 2022.

Almost 50 years apart.  Curtis Brubaker poses with his creation.   Both of these photos showcase the first streetable Box that he designed and built!!!!

So........why DRIVEN.co?  We have always felt that BOXX was an artistic product design masterpiece that never received its due.  BOXX was ahead of its time.  the time for BOXX is now.  Brilliant iconic product designs change little with the time.  BOXX retains the original flavor and yet adapts to the various propulsion platforms that are becoming available to coincide with our times.  Electric (EV), hydrogen, 4x4, self-driving, vintage vw.  BOXX can be adapted for all.

We've been looking for 40 years.  DRIVEN.CO finally received word of an unbuilt kit that had been languishing in a storage facility since new.  It was incomplete, piled over and inside with trash and junk, but to us......it was a priceless treasure.

Once we started to re-create missing parts, we were shocked by the incredible popularity that  the BOXX generated.  DRIVEN.CO began to look into the viability of creating a modern day version of the fiberglass body.  We then found out that lightening can sometime strike twice.  

One of the 3 original Brubaker Boxes that were manufactured had been unearthed in Florida.  DRIVEN.CO found ourselves immediately on a plane flying across the country to rescue another Box.  Indeed, there was a Box that had been claimed by the swamp, sitting out in the backwoods for some 25 years.  We met up with a couple of great guys and were able to drag the Brubaker Box out of its swampy grave.  

We have since been able to share "SWAMP BOX" at Pomona, the west coast's largest automotive swap meet allowing many enthusiasts their first in person viewing of this dilapidated piece of rolling artistry.  It was heart warming to find out how many people actually remember the Box and meet so many that couldn't believe it actually existed. As is unusual for car shows, it seemed that every age group found the Box appealing and were fascinated with BOXX and it's potential for the future.  Loved by "techys", off roaders, the custom crowd and purists alike. 

Though we didn't realize it at the time, and after much research, our fondly named "Swamp Box" turned out to be none other than the very same original brown Brubaker Box featured on the Car & Driver magazine cover!   DRIVEN.co has built some pretty awesome cars but we've never seen one draw a crowd like BOXX does.  Even in her rough condition, she is a favorite!

Sooo.........Why NOW ?  Well, possession of a Box is high on the list and we finally were able to make that a reality.  We have been doing our homework since then and getting feedback from enthusiasts likely to consider a BOXX kit.  Though most people don't dream of building their dream car, there is definitely a demand for a limited number of BOXX body kits.  When we began to contemplate offering BOXX kits, we noted the qualifications and requirements that would need to be in place to produce a successful project:

  • Possession.  Having the physical Brubaker Box in hand allows us do a proper job creating fiberglass bodies.
  • Automotive Experience.  A very strong automotive background is required to put together a kit that would be simple to build, inexpensive and adaptable to other applications.
  • Quality Resume.  Required to have an established and respected record in the automotive community and experience with rare vehicles and fabrication.  
  • Strong Interpersonal Business Relationships. Required due to the use of varied parts and suppliers.
  • Facility. A large, proper facility to conduct business, create products and package for shipping.
  • Shipping. BOXX is popular everywhere.  Shipping worldwide is mandatory.
  • Financing for Buyers. Easily affordable is a key value.
  • Support.  Having the support of the original producers of the Brubaker Box/AutoMecca Sports Van is huge.
  • Passion and Commitment.  Required to see a project of this magnitude come to fruition.

We submit that DRIVEN.CO can answer an affirmative YES to all of these solid points.  Take a look at  our website: https://www.DRIVEN.CO and our appearance on Pawn Stars 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0ZheG9PvHXY to see examples of our work.

AND.........DRIVEN.CO must produce these bodies NOW.  Otherwise, this automotive art design masterpiece will unlikely ever be produced.

We knew then that we have no choice but to produce BOXX.  We are absolutely thrilled to do so !!  The first step is to produce the fiberglass body.  We will have options available to suit your needs, ability and budget.  You too, will have the opportunity to own one of the few.  With our financing (OAC), everybody who wants to, can now afford to own their very own BOXX.  Build it to your own tastes and desires! 

DRIVEN.CO is:

Curtis Brubaker with Team Driven.co, educating us about his brainchild.

BOXX can come in different forms:

 Basic -  Complete fiberglass BOXX body, unassembled.  You may construct as per video instructions, or make changes as you see fit.  Included: Fiberglass tub, Roof panel body panels, nose, tail, door, knee dash panel.  This is the basic kit, which requires assembly of numerous fiberglass parts.  Perfect if you are considering modifications or alternative chassis or modes of power.  Please keep in mind that BOXX is a fiberglass body kit...….not an entire car.  There will be time, money and effort necessary to finalize your personalized BOXX.

 

Assembled -  Includes the Basic kit, but the major fiberglass body panels are assembled and bonded prior to shipping.  Similar to the picture shown below, but with some additional fiberglass parts.

BOXX fiberglass body kit, shown suspended over a VW beetle chassis, shown in Assembled form.  VW chassis and drivetrain not included.

Assembled BOXX fiberglass body kit, shows the spacious unique bare interior.

 

 

Option - Door kit -  Includes hardware to install sliding door.

Option - bumper kit.  If you decide you'd like to utilize the original styled wood look bumpers.

Option - component kit - Includes major & upgraded parts for your build; windshield, backglass and trim, LED tailights, perspex side glass and slide channels, gas tank, side marker lights, front sunroof, upgraded pedals, LED turn signal lamps.

Option - Worldwide shipping options are available.  All parts are F.O.B. zip code 90680.

For all kits, you will need to provide your own donor car for BOXX body to sit on, and provide it's power.  You will also need to have various components assembled to your own specifications.  BOXX is a kit, not a completed vehicle.

Stretch goal 1: BOXX set up for 4x4 platform.  on/off road use.  

Stretch goal 2: BOXX set up for EV skateboard platform (electric battery powered, ala Tesla 3 etc.)

 

History and Timeline

At DRIVEN.CO our goal is to exceed expectations with a transparent campaign. 

Hows the money spent ?  

 - Fulfill the BOXX support rewards

- Design and fabrication creating the fiberglass body molds, fit and finish.

- Tooling for the hardware for BOXX.  

- Materials and production equipment for the BOXX fiberglass body

- Labor and overhead cost involved with producing BOXX

- Refurbish "SWAMP BOX"for  back to original car cover appearance, for its role in the fulfillment of rewards

- Marketing and Indiegogo fees.  

BOXX is a grand undertaking......but one that will save and embellish an artistic legend

Original Brubaker Box, AutoMecca Sports Van sales brochures.

An example of an electric (EV) chassis, or "skateboard".  Perfect adaptation for BOXX.

For some of us, the first Brubaker Box was saw was on TV.  The 70's TV show ARKII featured a modified Box named "ROAMER".  It was driven on the show by children, and even an ape.

Toyota's new electric GEN-Z concept.  Hmmmmm…...I think I've seen that shape before?

The original "get into it" Brubaker Box poster.  Copies are available as a reward.

The recently created tail panel mold and new tail panel.

Recently created door mold, and new door panel.

The recently created new nose panel.

 

 

 

 

ro

DRIVEN.CO rescues a rough Alfa Romero GT Junior, and brings it back better than new.

 

A Volvo 1800es gets a stunning DRIVEN.CO treatment.

 

DRIVEN.CO gives new life to a languishing Datsun 240 Z.

 

 

Another before and after transformation by DRIVEN.CO.  Here we have a 1963 Ford Falcon Sprint convertible, and DRIVEN.CO's take on the 1965 Ford Mustang.

 

DRIVEN.CO makes a Fiat 850 Sport Coupe and a Dodge Dart better than when they left the factory.

From the ridiculous, to the sublime.  DRIVEN.CO takes on projects few others would attempt.  Two very rare, and very different cars from the 1959.  A Rolls Royce limousine, and a unique Goliath Tiger.  Shocking transformations.

DRIVEN.CO rescues a 1957 Ford Ranch Wagon, and a Devin SS sports racer.

 

DRIVEN.CO's expertise has few boundaries.  Here is our take on a black Sebring kit car, a striped Sunbeam Roadster, a classic 1967 Cadillac Eldorado, and Eddie Van Halen's personal Ferrari, which has an amazing past.

Please join our Indiegogo community and help save this automotive art design masterpiece from extinction.  You could own the next BOXX to be built and driven around town!  
DRIVEN.co has obtained the original very first Brubaker Box.  the same car that appeared on the cover of Car and Driver magazine in March of 1972, all the sales brochures, and several movies.  We tracked it down and found it dilapidated and left for dead in a Florida swamp.  We could restore the car like we often do, and see it go into a private collection but we think the BOXX is truly special.  It deserves better.  It should be driven and enjoyed by you, those interested in art design and automotive BOXX aficionados everywhere.  
If you are shy this may not be the car for you.  BOXX draws a crowd and attention everywhere it goes.  Some say that BOXX was the very first true modern mini-van, but  BOXX artistic design almost defies traditional descriptions.  Its quirky utilitarian design was innovative in its day, and has become iconic.  It still looks futuristic today.   
BOXX is a fiberglass body shell kit that fits on an unmodified Volkswagen Beetle chassis after the car's body is removed.  BOXX turns a funky little Volkswagen Bug into one of the coolest cars you could ever possibly drive on the street.  Want to be the center of conversation anywhere you go?...…..then this is your ticket!!
YOU and BOXX?
BOXX is an amazing piece of artistic design that you can use and share.
BOXX attracts attention like no other vehicle.  Put that together with your business or enjoy the roads and shows with something no one else has.
BOXX is built to your personal tastes, by you, or with your kids, or buddies.  Each unique BOXX displays your take on the classic design and your pride of ownership.
BOXX is rare and almost extinct.  Join the team to save BOXX.  Let's get them back on the road, be it electric, hydrogen, 4x4, autonomous driving, or?

story:
ScootYa ?

Why we decided to create ScootYa ? Traffic jams, lots of cars everywhere, long waiting for a public transport and you don’t even have a seat there...Would you like to solve these problems and instead of them have some fun ? All these issues have one solution. SCOOTYA !

Our main goal is to come up with an affordable product which contains high quality frame and all components. The first idea was based on a saving time. What does it mean ? No more wasted time on charging the batteries. We want to make something more powerful, reliable and last but not least, to reduce charging time. A product was designed by skilled constructors. Every buyer have a chance to make own-designed product. Start it and ride it ! That’s a ScootYa. 

ABOUT - Specifications and details 

The ScootYa is a fast and great to ride scooter. A strong frame, welded by a profesionals can load a rider with weight up to 120 kilograms/264lb.

Riding a 49cc gas engine is so much fun. It has more than 4 hp (horsepower). Just start, twist a throttle and go for an unforgettable rides. Yes, no troubles with starting a gas engine, scooter got an electric starter, which you can control by pushing a button on the handlebars. It’s so easy.

 

Of course, we care about a consumpiton. Only 0,8 litres/0,21 gallons plastic gas tank allowed you to ride for a 35 kilometres/22 miles. Pro version offers 1,3 litres/0,34 gallons gas tank, with which you will be able to ride 50 kilometers/31 miles. So smart and affordable, don't you think ?

 

  • Automatic switch on/off SPEEDOMETER with 14 functions (f.e. Actual speed, Average speed, Maximum speed, Thermometer, Total distance, Trip distance, Time etc.
  • LED headlight (with 3 functions - Dipped light, Long-distance light, Flickering)
  • 3000 lumens of power

 

  • CNC throtle controller
  • Buttons onboard for switching on/off and electric start of engine

 

  • 4 LEDs waterproof taillight

 

  • Automatic chain tensioner
  • Anti-skid deck grip
  • Chrome coating exhaust

But, how about speed ? Everyone turns around when you go down the street at 34mph / 55 km/h. Automatic transmission, no worries about shifting gears. Everything is automatic. For that unbelievable speed, we equiped scooter with 2 disc mechanical brakes.

Whole construction is carried on the 6.5 inch wheels with wide tires for a better stability. Not only man appreciate the scooter, we also got an attention on woman needs. Scooter can be used everytime when you want to go shop something, because it’s equiped with a removable basket. Just detach, shop and again put on the scooter.  

We made a recharging system on the battery located under the desk. It means, that a battery recharges everytime when you start the scooter. Engine has a small electric components, which allows to recharge power during the ride. Electric power is used for the front and back lights. Everything is controlled by a switch, just simply change the position of switch for turning on/off the lights. Both of disc brakes are controlled by the 2 aluminium brake levers. Of course, we spent so much time on connectivity. Every rider have a chance to charge various kinds of devices by the USB plug.

 

But what is special ? No driving licence is needed !

Four designes or more ? 

We offer 4 versions of our scooter. Urban, Pro, Sport, Eco. Every important information can be founded in the table bellow. We are working now on electric version. As we said before, our goal is save the time on charging batteries. We are working on the half hour charging cyclus, which means, that you can recharge our ScootYa Eco in 30 minutes to the full capacity. Everything is in the progress. Enjoy.

Our second goal is to not just made and design a product for selling to a buyers. We want to give an opportunity to you, to your creativity. You can change a color of every part on a scooter. We are prepared to make everything possible. We just need more finances for creating a website, which will offer a 3D fully customizable model. Your requirements are our pleasure.

 

Timeline

Every moment of our creating is captured and written in this timeline. We spent so much time for a realizing whole idea and starting this project. Definitely, it was hard to find right way to make everything happend, making contacts with suppliers of all parts and finding the great team. 

 

Video is on the right way of editing before we publish it out to the public. Please, be patient. Thank to everybody, who backs this project, we really appreciate it. It won't be possible without YOU. 

FAQ:

Do not hesitate to contact us about your questions. We gladly answer your questions.
story_txt:
ScootYa ?
Why we decided to create ScootYa ? Traffic jams, lots of cars everywhere, long waiting for a public transport and you don’t even have a seat there...Would you like to solve these problems and instead of them have some fun ? All these issues have one solution. SCOOTYA !

Our main goal is to come up with an affordable product which contains high quality frame and all components. The first idea was based on a saving time. What does it mean ? No more wasted time on charging the batteries. We want to make something more powerful, reliable and last but not least, to reduce charging time. A product was designed by skilled constructors. Every buyer have a chance to make own-designed product. Start it and ride it ! That’s a ScootYa. 
ABOUT - Specifications and details 

The ScootYa is a fast and great to ride scooter. A strong frame, welded by a profesionals can load a rider with weight up to 120 kilograms/264lb.

Riding a 49cc gas engine is so much fun. It has more than 4 hp (horsepower). Just start, twist a throttle and go for an unforgettable rides. Yes, no troubles with starting a gas engine, scooter got an electric starter, which you can control by pushing a button on the handlebars. It’s so easy.

 
Of course, we care about a consumpiton. Only 0,8 litres/0,21 gallons plastic gas tank allowed you to ride for a 35 kilometres/22 miles. Pro version offers 1,3 litres/0,34 gallons gas tank, with which you will be able to ride 50 kilometers/31 miles. So smart and affordable, don't you think ?
 

Automatic switch on/off SPEEDOMETER with 14 functions (f.e. Actual speed, Average speed, Maximum speed, Thermometer, Total distance, Trip distance, Time etc.
LED headlight (with 3 functions - Dipped light, Long-distance light, Flickering)
3000 lumens of power

  

CNC throtle controller
Buttons onboard for switching on/off and electric start of engine

  
4 LEDs waterproof taillight
  

Automatic chain tensioner
Anti-skid deck grip
Chrome coating exhaust

But, how about speed ? Everyone turns around when you go down the street at 34mph / 55 km/h. Automatic transmission, no worries about shifting gears. Everything is automatic. For that unbelievable speed, we equiped scooter with 2 disc mechanical brakes. 
Whole construction is carried on the 6.5 inch wheels with wide tires for a better stability. Not only man appreciate the scooter, we also got an attention on woman needs. Scooter can be used everytime when you want to go shop something, because it’s equiped with a removable basket. Just detach, shop and again put on the scooter.   
We made a recharging system on the battery located under the desk. It means, that a battery recharges everytime when you start the scooter. Engine has a small electric components, which allows to recharge power during the ride. Electric power is used for the front and back lights. Everything is controlled by a switch, just simply change the position of switch for turning on/off the lights. Both of disc brakes are controlled by the 2 aluminium brake levers. Of course, we spent so much time on connectivity. Every rider have a chance to charge various kinds of devices by the USB plug.
  
But what is special ? No driving licence is needed !

Four designes or more ? 
We offer 4 versions of our scooter. Urban, Pro, Sport, Eco. Every important information can be founded in the table bellow. We are working now on electric version. As we said before, our goal is save the time on charging batteries. We are working on the half hour charging cyclus, which means, that you can recharge our ScootYa Eco in 30 minutes to the full capacity. Everything is in the progress. Enjoy.

Our second goal is to not just made and design a product for selling to a buyers. We want to give an opportunity to you, to your creativity. You can change a color of every part on a scooter. We are prepared to make everything possible. We just need more finances for creating a website, which will offer a 3D fully customizable model. Your requirements are our pleasure.
 

Timeline
Every moment of our creating is captured and written in this timeline. We spent so much time for a realizing whole idea and starting this project. Definitely, it was hard to find right way to make everything happend, making contacts with suppliers of all parts and finding the great team. 
  
Video is on the right way of editing before we publish it out to the public. Please, be patient. Thank to everybody, who backs this project, we really appreciate it. It won't be possible without YOU. 
FAQ:
Do not hesitate to contact us about your questions. We gladly answer your questions.

story:
The Story:
I started out as an avid bicycle commuter. I loved riding my bike to work. Unfortunately I had no place to change out of sweat soaked clothes. Then one day, a friend who suffered the same problem, told me he wanted me to make his bike electric. He did not like the available electric bikes and he wanted me to make his mountain bike electric. So, to make a long story short, we spent two years building and rebuilding electric bikes until we developed what we consider to be one of the most practical electric bikes we know of.

The Facts:

There is a huge, little known movement going on in the USA right now. Electric bikes are becoming more popular as more people are seeking alternative commuting methods due to environmental awareness and the ever increasing price of gasoline. In 2012 there were 70,000 electric bike sold in the USA. Then in 2013 that number doubled to 140,000.

The Goal:

The two main problems for people who want to buy an electric bike, are the availability of electric bikes and the high prices. My goal is to build practical electric bikes at a reasonable price. If you compare these bikes to others, make sure you are comparing apples with apples. Check the motor wattage, the batter voltage and battery amp hours (Ah). The cheaper bikes will have lower wattage, voltage and Ah.

Eventually I plan to build all the parts in the USA (including the motors), but to start I must order parts from China. In order to keep cost low I must order at least 100 of all the parts. That is why this is an "all or nothing" campaign. I cannot do this if I cannot reach the goal to build 100 bikes.

To read the full (extended version) of the bike story and to learn more about the team please see our web site. 

www.evtexsun.com

Mountain Bikes as Electric Bikes:

Most electric bikes seem to be a choice between style or practicality. The reason we spent so much time developing these bikes is that we had to find the right balance. What you learn when you convert a bike to electric is that a lot of dynamics change. When you pedal a bike you do not really spend much time going 20mph. You really need the comfort a mountain bike offers. The mountain bike is best suited to convert to an electric bike because it offers suspension which makes for a much smoother ride. Unfortunately the reasons we love the mountain bikes are also the reasons they are not totally practical. When you ride a bike everyday as a method of commuting you find that you need practical things like fenders. If you hit a wet section in the road or especially ride in the rain, then wet underwear become a problem. Therefore, fenders are a must. 

Our main feature is the battery case:

Really the biggest problem is that most electric bikes mount the battery over the rear tire. We found that having the battery over the back tire made the bike extremely unbalanced. If you ever need to lift the bike, you find that it is very awkward since the front wants to fly way in the air. Therefore, the main feature of our bike is the battery case. It is centered in the frame and low on the bike. It is easy to put on and take off of the bike so you do not have to carry the whole bike into the office or apartment to charge, and it looks good.

Practicality - form follows function:

This is the bike I rode everyday, no matter what the weather was. I made the battery case myself and it is not a very professional job. Remember this is a prototype and the real bikes will have cases made by professionals.


Cool But Not Practical:

For some bizarre reason I stripped my bike. What a mistake. It looks really cool but one day I rode to a function and on the way there happened to be a strip of road that was wet. I had to spend several hours in wet underwear and even had to speak to a crowd. I strongly advocate fenders on the bikes.

The Parts:

I will use a bike similar to this one. Pretty cool I think.


This is the motor kit. 350W, rear wheel hub motor. 


The Battery:

The 36V 10Ah battery pack enclosed in a nice safe metal box as shown above in the pictures of my bike. Again I want to say that I made the battery boxes above with hand tools on the balcony of my apartment. The ones on this set of bikes will be done by professionals (with proper tools) and the batteries will be put in the case by the battery factory, so it will be 100% safe.

Technical Details:

  • These bikes run 20mph. This is really fast on a bike, if you want to go faster, get a motorcycle.
  • The bike will go for 1.5 hours on a charge. This is at full throttle or dead stop, no pedaling or any efforts at extended range. Does this mean you will go 30 miles? I do not know as I only measure the time I ride not the miles. I think most people's statistics are highly questionable when they quote range. Have those people who quote that their bikes goes 40 miles actually driven their bike 40 miles? Don't trust those kind of quotes.
  • It takes 3 hours to charge a dead battery. You need to keep Lithium batteries charged. It is bad for the battery to sit for long periods of time without being charged regularly (at least once a month). This is another reason that the battery is designed to be removable and easy to put somewhere to charge.

Service After Sale:

There is no reason to worry about having trouble with these bikes. I will be happy to guarantee the bike parts for 60 days after you receive them. Problems are rare. However, in case there is a problem, I will have spare parts and will be easily reachable to assist in troubleshooting and repair. The components are all modular and simple to troubleshoot.


Logo for t-shirt:

This is a logo an aspiring artist did for me when I had a t-shirt screen printing business. No e-bike logo yet, but I think it makes a nice t-shirt picture.  (What I learned from the t-shirt business is that I am a technical person and live for technical projects.)

story:
DriveHER

First we would like to say, as you may have heard in recent news about UBER supporting Trump, We are NOT like UBER. We are a social enterprise providing a service that believes in representation, and inclusion. We are here to make a difference for a better tomorrow.

-

DriveHER, a start-up based out of Toronto, ON, is a safe and an alternative ride-share service dedicated for women by women. DriveHER is the result of an experience Aisha Addo, the founder, had encountered; and in result of many experiences that came before her.

It was a late night in Downtown,Toronto when Aisha hopped into a cab to make it back home in Mississauga, ON. The driver struck up casual conversation that quickly turned uncomfortable when he began making sexual comments and asking personal questions like whether she lived alone. At that moment, Aisha took the opportunity to create a women-only ride-share service for Toronto and the GTA, to give women an alternative and provide a safe space.

As of January 2017,  we are waiting for the insurance policy to kick in before we get our drivers safely on the road. We are so pleased to know that some of you have already downloaded the app, and some of you have signed up to drive with us. It shows that you care and that yo want to make a difference. With your continuous love and support we hope to not only drive in Toronto, and the GTA, but nation-wide!

 

What We Need & What You Get

On May 3, 2016, Toronto City Council made a series of decisions related to taxicab, limousine and Private Transportation Company (PTC) regulations. In order for DriveHER to launch and operate within the city of Toronto we would have to be regulated and licensed as a Private Transportation Company (PTC).

To operate in Toronto we will need to raise a total of $25,000  to cover the licensing fees, and administrative costs to get our women on the road.

Start-up Costs:

PTC Licence Fees: $20,000.00

Administration Costs: $5,000

REWARDS

$20(CAD): DriveHER Merch. Set - A DriveHER sticker, 1 tote-bag, and 1 t-shirt.

$30(CAD): Digital Shout Out + 1 Tote Bag - In addition to your DriveHER tote-bag , we want to acknowledge you and give you a shout out on our website and social media platforms.

$60(CAD): DriveHER Launch Party - You will receive one exclusive ticket to the invite-only DriveHER launch Party.

$100(CAD): HER Magazine Shout Out - Your name will be listed on our sponsor pages of DriveHER's 'HER Magazine' Issue 01. The magazine will be found in all of our drivers' vehicles. of the first issue.

$200(CAD): Business Pkg. 1 - 1/2 ad space in DriveHER's 'HER Magazine' Issue 01 + $25 DriveHER Credit + 10  DriveHER Merch. Sets. The magazine will be found in all of our drivers' vehicles. of the first issue.

$300(CAD): Business Pkg. 2 - Full page ad space in DriveHER's 'HER Magazine' Issue 01+ $50 Ride-Credit + 10 DriveHER Merch. Sets.The magazine will be found in all of our drivers' vehicles. of the first issue.

 

The Impact & How We Intend to Create Social Change

  • Decrease violence against women by drivers of taxis and other ride-sharing services
  • Provide free rides to women and children who are fleeing domestic abuse
  • Provide a safe and an alternate ride-service for women across Canada
  • Create spaces that allows both drivers and passengers to feel safe
  • Include men and young boys in the conversation and educate them about rape culture and violence/abuse/assault against women
  • Empower and train women to become drivers and gain new skills

Our Challenge

In the midst of launching DriveHER we have encountered a road block.  Since we can not operate in the City of Toronto, Drivers will only be able to drop customers off in Toronto but can NOT pick them up in the city. Therefore, the driver must drive out of the city (i.e York ,Halton, Peel & Durham) to pick up a new customer. With that said, this has been the most challenging to recruit drivers and keep interests in registered drivers for our service. The lack of drivers' support results to the lack of ridership, which then means we can not raise the money on our own to operate in the city of Toronto.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Third time's a charm! Our goal is to raise $25,000 (CAD) to operate in City of Toronto. If you can not donate, that doesn't mean you can not contribute to creating social change. Help us spread the word by sharing this campaign using social media, Indiegogo sharing tools, and/or word of mouth. Anything that will help bring awareness.

Thank you all for your contribution and support. You are truly helping us make herstory and a huge difference in our city and Canada. We appreciate it very very much!

Remember, share, share, share!

story:
THIS IS A GRASSROOTS CAMPAIGN! 

The jobs and livelihoods of so very many are at stake. Countless executives risk losing their summer houses. Their offspring may have to receive education in public schools. Help save the world from the predatory depredations of Tesla!

Please donate if you can. Every little bit counts.

The plan: 

  1. Buy an island.
  2. Develop the island into safe, secure and protected conference environment. 
  3. Work jointly to protect the world from an oilless future
